Summary: At the end of the Spanish civil war, Fando, a boy of about ten, tries to make sense of war and his father&#039;s arrest. His mother is religious, sympathetic to the Fascists; his father is accused of being a Red. Fando discovers that his mother may have aided in his father&#039;s arrest. Sometimes we witness Fando imagining explanations for what&#039;s going on; sometimes we see him at play, alone or with his friend ThÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©rÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨se. Oedipal fantasies and a lad&#039;s natural curiosity about sex and death mix with his search for his mother&#039;s nature and his father&#039;s fate. Will Fando survive the search?
